[ACTION] south [STATE] Clearing You are in a small clearing in a well marked forest path that extends to the east and west. [ACTION] east [STATE] Clearing You are in a small clearing in a well marked forest path that extends to the east and west. [ACTION] east [STATE] Canyon View You are at the top of the Great Canyon on its west wall. From here there is a marvelous view of the canyon and parts of the Frigid River upstream. Across the canyon, the walls of the White Cliffs join the mighty ramparts of the Flathead Mountains to the east. Following the Canyon upstream to the north, Aragain Falls may be seen, complete with rainbow. The mighty Frigid River flows out from a great dark cavern. To the west and south can be seen an immense forest, stretching for miles around. A path leads northwest. It is possible to climb down into the canyon from here. [ACTION] west [STATE] Canyon View You are at the top of the Great Canyon on its west wall. From here there is a marvelous view of the canyon and parts of the Frigid River upstream. [ACTION] enter [STATE] Inside the Barrow As you enter the barrow, the door closes inexorably behind you. Around you it is dark, but ahead is an enormous cavern, brightly lit. Through its center runs a wide stream. Spanning the stream is a small wooden footbridge, and beyond a path leads into a dark tunnel. Above the bridge, floating in the air, is a large sign. It reads: All ye who stand before this bridge have completed a great and perilous adventure which has tested your wit and courage. You have mastered the first part of the ZORK trilogy. Those who pass over this bridge must be prepared to undertake an even greater adventure that will severely test your skill and bravery! The ZORK trilogy continues with "ZORK II: The Wizard of Frobozz" and is completed in "ZORK III: The Dungeon Master." Your score is 350 (total of 350 points), in 472 moves. This gives you the rank of Master Adventurer. debugcheapnitfol quit with exit status: 0 [ACTION] press green button [STATE] Inside the Barrow As you enter the barrow, the door closes inexorably behind you. Around you it is dark, but ahead is an enormous cavern, brightly lit. Through its center runs a wide stream. Spanning the stream is a small wooden footbridge, and beyond a path leads into a dark tunnel. Above the bridge, floating in the air, is a large sign. It reads: All ye who stand before this bridge have completed a great and perilous adventure which has tested your wit and courage. You have mastered the first part of the ZORK trilogy. Those who pass over this bridge must be prepared to undertake an even greater adventure that will severely test your skill and bravery! The ZORK trilogy continues with "ZORK II: The Wizard of Frobozz" and is completed in "ZORK III: The Dungeon Master." Your score is 350 (total of 350 points), in 472 moves. This gives you the rank of Master Adventurer. debugcheapnitfol quit with exit status: 0 [ACTION] press green button [STATE] People who'd probably hate to be associated with this, and probably don't know why I'm thanking them, but whom I ought to mention for one reason or another: David "flatterer" Dyte, Lucian "Lucian" Smith, Neil de Mause, Dan "inky" Shiovitz, David Wildstrom, L. Ross Raszewski, Andrew Plotkin, Zak Arntson, Gareth Rees, Graham "of course" Nelson. And all those raif posters whose questions and answers I plundered via DejaNews. Most of the game text that I haven't made up on the spot was taken from Dungeon; some other from Zork, which, as it said in the blurb, is a registered trademark of Activision, Inc. and is used with permission. (Cheers, Laird.) Note that this game is freeware. Do with it what you will, bar hacking it about and not saying that you've done so. Gaudete. Ross Raszewski, Andrew Plotkin, Zak Arntson, Gareth Rees, Graham "of course" Nelson. And all those raif posters whose questions and answers I plundered via DejaNews. Most of the game text that I haven't made up on the spot was taken from Dungeon; some other from Zork, which, as it said in the blurb, is a registered trademark of Activision, Inc. and is used with permission. (Cheers, Laird.) Note that this game is freeware. Do with it what you will, bar hacking it about and not saying that you've done so. Gaudete. [Please press SPACE.] [ACTION] again [STATE] [ACTION] north [STATE] [ACTION] north [STATE] It's a study of the relative paradigms of moral identity in classic and modern IF, intended to throw sidelights on the motivation of the player and of NPCs and their relative role in plot construction and development. [Please press SPACE.] [ACTION] north [STATE] It's a study of the relative paradigms of moral identity in classic and modern IF, intended to throw sidelights on the motivation of the player and of NPCs and their relative role in plot construction and development. [ACTION] sing [STATE] You experimentally tap the floor with the haft of your axe. Doesn't seem worth trying to dig through. [ACTION] sing [STATE] Your singing is abominable. [ACTION] jump [STATE] Your singing is abominable. [ACTION] jump [STATE] You jump on the spot, fruitlessly. [ACTION] look [STATE] You jump on the spot, fruitlessly. [ACTION] look [STATE] The Troll Room This is a small room with passages to the east and south and a forbidding hole leading west. Bloodstains and deep scratches (perhaps made by an axe) mar the walls. [ACTION] west [STATE] The Troll Room This is a small room with passages to the east and south and a forbidding hole leading west. Bloodstains and deep scratches (perhaps made by an axe) mar the walls. [ACTION] west [STATE] The passages through there are twisty and all alike. You don't want to get lost. An adventurer strides in from the south, carrying a brass lantern. While your eyes adjust to the sudden light, he most unsportingly attacks you! Slash! His blow lands! That one hit an artery, it could be serious! [ACTION] attack adventurer [STATE] The passages through there are twisty and all alike. You don't want to get lost. An adventurer strides in from the south, carrying a brass lantern. While your eyes adjust to the sudden light, he most unsportingly attacks you! Slash! His blow lands! That one hit an artery, it could be serious! [ACTION] attack adventurer [STATE] The flat of your axe hits the adventurer delicately on the head, knocking him out. [ACTION] again [STATE] The flat of your axe hits the adventurer delicately on the head, knocking him out. [ACTION] again [STATE] The unconscious adventurer cannot defend himself; he dies. The body of the adventurer, and all his possessions, suddenly disappear in a puff of orange smoke. [ACTION] diagnose [STATE] The unconscious adventurer cannot defend himself; he dies. The body of the adventurer, and all his possessions, suddenly disappear in a puff of orange smoke. [ACTION] diagnose [STATE] You have a serious wound. [ACTION] again [STATE] You have a serious wound. [ACTION] again [STATE] You have a serious wound. [ACTION] again [STATE] You have a serious wound. [ACTION] again [STATE] You have a serious wound. [ACTION] west [STATE] You have a serious wound. [ACTION] west [STATE] The passages through there are twisty and all alike. You don't want to get lost. [ACTION] wait [STATE] The passages through there are twisty and all alike. You don't want to get lost. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] diagnose [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] diagnose [STATE] You have a light wound. [ACTION] wait [STATE] You have a light wound. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] wait [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] sleep [STATE] Time passes. [ACTION] sleep [STATE] Hey! No sleeping on duty! [ACTION] look [STATE] Hey! No sleeping on duty! [ACTION] look [STATE] The Troll Room This is a small room with passages to the east and south and a forbidding hole leading west. [ACTION] throw axe [STATE] The Troll Room This is a small room with passages to the east and south and a forbidding hole leading west. Bloodstains and deep scratches (perhaps made by an axe) mar the walls. [ACTION] throw axe [STATE] What if an adventurer came upon you unawares? Fine guard you'd be. An adventurer strides in from the south, carrying a brass lantern. While your eyes adjust to the sudden light, she most unsportingly attacks you! The adventurer's sword flashes out and connects painfully with your midriff. [ACTION] attack adventurer
